text: You were a simple farmhand. The smell of hay and iron soil filled your days.
But tonight—the sky is red with fire.
Goblins swarm your village, torches raised, shrieking with bloodlust.
You seize a battered axe and stand your ground, but the raiders pour in from every direction.
Your neighbors fall. Your home burns. Wounded and alone, you flee into the dark woods.
By dawn, you reach the north road. Smoke still clings to your clothes.
With nothing but resolve and a scarred axe, you stagger onward toward the only hope you know.
